wikipedia_page.main:
Wendy Morgan is a former Deputy in the States of Guernsey, the parliament of the Bailiwick of Guernsey in the Channel Islands.
Wendy Morgan was elected in 2004 and represented the electoral district of St. Peter Port North, but failed to gain a seat in the 2008 elections.  Deputy Wendy Morgan was the Deputy Minister of Education and controversy by proposing that the current student grant system should include a student loan in funding undergraduate courses.
Her husband, Laurie Morgan, was the Chief Minister of Guernsey from 2004 until 2007 when he was forced to resign by the Fallagate scandal.

response: His wife, Wendy Morgan, serves as a Deputy for St. Peter Port North and as Deputy Minister for Education.

The 2008 Guernsey general election was held on 23 April 2008 to elect 45 members of the States of Guernsey. 18,576 voters or 40.58% of the eligible population of 45,772 turned out and cast a total of 89,239 votes; there were 10 blank papers, 35 spoilt papers and on average 4.8 votes were cast. Of the 28 standing deputies all but two (Brian de Jersey and Wendy Morgan), were re-elected to the house; this means that 19 of the Deputies-Elect are new to the chamber. Five of the 12 candidates who had stood unsuccessfully in 2004 were elected in 2008.
* Wendy Morgan (politician), former Deputy in the States of Guernsey
* Wendy Morgan, pen name of Wendy Corsi Staub (born 1964), American writer
